tutorial.title: Displaying Elements
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to change the way elements behave on a webpage.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
Normal flow is the way elements display on a webpage by default.

For example, headings and paragraphs appear on their own line while links and buttons get grouped on the same line.

lessons.title: Display
lessons.interactiveContent:
The display property decides whether or not an element appears on the same line.

Make sure to pick display.

lessons.title: Inline
lessons.interactiveContent:
For a elements, the default value of the display property is inline.

Make sure to pick inline.

lessons.title: Inline size
lessons.interactiveContent:
height and width don't work on inline elements. Instead, they keep the size of the content inside them.

Make sure to pick 3000px.

lessons.title: Inline elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
Examples of inline elements include a, em and strong. They all appear on the same line when coded after each other.

Make sure to pick <a href="#">, followed by <em>, and finally <strong>.

lessons.title: Pushed down
lessons.interactiveContent:
If multiple inline elements don't fit inside the width of their parent, the elements towards the end move down to the next line.

Make sure to pick <a href="#">, followed by #workHardPlayHard, and finally </a>.

lessons.title: Question: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's normal flow?

The way elements display on a webpage by defaultThe default size of images

The way elements display on a webpage by default.

lessons.title: Question: Display
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does the display property do?

Determine if elements appear on the same line or notChange the opacity of an element

Determine if elements appear on the same line or not.

lessons.title: Question: Inline
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which property do these em elements have?

display: inline;color: blue;

display: inline;.

lessons.title: Question: Inline size
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we set the height or width of an inline element?

Nothing, these properties don't work on themThe element's size changes

Nothing, these properties don't work on them.

lessons.title: Question: Inline elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does this code display? Keep in mind that a and strong are both inline elements.

Two inline elements on the same lineTwo inline elements on different lines

Two inline elements on the same line.

lessons.title: Question: Pushed down
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when the contents of inline elements inside a div exceed the width of the div?

The inline elements get pushed down to the next lines when they don't fitThe inline elements fill up the entire page width

The inline elements get pushed down to the next lines when they don't fit.

lessons.title: Example: Display
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the display property.

Make sure to type display.

lessons.title: Example: Inline
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the inline value.

Make sure to type inline.

lessons.title: Example: Inline elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make what? an inline element.

Make sure to pick <strong>, followed by </strong>.

lessons.title: Example: Pushed down
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the code so that the two text elements appear on the same line.

Make sure to pick <div>, followed by <strong>, and finally </strong>.

lessons.title: Paragraphs vs links
lessons.interactiveContent: Elements like p, div, or h3 work differently in normal flow than inline elements. They always appear on separate lines.

lessons.title: Block
lessons.interactiveContent:
The display value for elements taking the entire width of their parent element is block.

Make sure to pick block.

lessons.title: New line
lessons.interactiveContent:
Since they take up the full width of their parent, block elements always start on a new line.

Make sure to pick <p>, followed by 40% OFF, and finally </p>.

lessons.title: Question: Paragraphs vs links
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of these elements are block elements?

p , div , h1 , h2 , h3a , em , strong

p , div , h1 , h2 , h3.

lessons.title: Question: Block
lessons.interactiveContent:
What do block elements do?

They take up the entire width of the parent elementThey can fit on the same line as inline elements

They take up the entire width of the parent element.

lessons.title: Question: New line
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we have a p element with very little text inside of it and an empty style.css file?

Since p is a block element, it takes up the entire lineThe inline element below it appears on the same line

Since p is a block element, it takes up the entire line.

lessons.title: Example: Paragraphs vs links
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the block element.

Make sure to pick <p>, followed by </p>.

lessons.title: Example: Block
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the display value to block.

Make sure to type block.

lessons.title: Example: New line
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the snippets so that there are two inline elements on the same line.

Make sure to pick <p> followed by </p> and then <em>, </em>.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent: You may have noticed that buttons and images are displayed differently than inline or block elements.

lessons.title: Inline-block elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
Elements like button and img have inline-block as their default display value.

Make sure to pick inline-block.

lessons.title: Size
lessons.interactiveContent:
inline-block puts elements on the same line, while also letting us change their size.

Make sure to pick height, followed by :, and finally 50px.

lessons.title: Inline-block
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can set an element's display property to a different value when we want to change how they look and behave on a webpage.

Make sure to pick inline-block followed by height and then :, 100px, ;.

lessons.title: Question: Inline-block elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which elements have inline-block as their default display value?

button and img div and strong

button and img .

lessons.title: Question: Button size
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we change the size of an inline-block element?

The size changes. It's one of the features of inline-block elementsIt doesn't work, just like with inline elements

The size changes. It's one of the features of inline-block elements.

lessons.title: Question: Inline-block
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we change the display value of an element from block to inline-block?

The element becomes an inline-block elementIt doesn't work, display values are fixed

The element becomes an inline-block element.

lessons.title: Example: Inline-block elements
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the display value as inline-block.

Make sure to pick inline-block.

lessons.title: Example: Size
lessons.interactiveContent:
Change the display value of the em element to inline-block so that we can change its size.

Make sure to pick display followed by : and then inline-block, ;.

lessons.title: Example: Size 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Change the display value of the em element to block.

Make sure to type block.

lessons.title: Example: Inline-block divs
lessons.interactiveContent:
Change the display value for div elements to inline-block to put them all on the same line.

Make sure to type inline-block.
